title: 6. Group discussion - Day 1 afternoon
text:
Discussion

Have any of your goals shifted from what you thought you wanted to tackle earlier this morning?
Any new ideas on features you are hoping to incorporate?
Any features we didn’t cover today that you were hoping to learn more about?

title: 6. Group discussion - Day 1 afternoon
text:
Homework

Don’t forget to bring your data (or you can use ours)
See you tomorrow at 0830!


Home

title: 11. Deployment
text:
Local deployment


runApp for RStudio
launch from GitHub

shiny::runGitHub(“your-repo-name”, username = “github-username”, ref = “branch”)

title: 11. Deployment
text:
Server deployment


‘Shiny’ servers

Free and paid options

shinyapps.io
Considerations of interaction with internal systems


talk to your IT department

title: 11. Deployment
text:
Other


Shiny apps can be as complicated or as simple as required
More interaction with your app necessitates more internal checks to be in place
Consideration to who and how your app will be used



Home

title: 2b. Apps in action - WhaleMap
text:
Quarto
Quarto enables you to weave together content and executable code into a finished presentation. To learn more about Quarto presentations see https://quarto.org/docs/presentations/.

title: 2b. Apps in action - WhaleMap
text:
Bullets
When you click the Render button a document will be generated that includes:

Content authored with markdown
Output from executable code

title: 7. Overview of the day
text:
Welcome to Day 2!


Morning sessions 08:30–12:00 with a coffee break 10:00–10:30
Lunch 12:30–13:30
Afternoon sessions 13:30–17:30 with a coffee break 15:00–15:30
The repository (aka ‘repo’) is our workshop landing page:
https://github.com/NEFSC/READ-PSB-LWT-Shiny_SMM22

title: 7. Overview of the day
text:
Day 2 Schedule



0830-0900: Overview and discussion
0900-1030: Build shiny widget

1000-1030: Coffee

1030-1100: Check-in
1100-1200: Continue with building widget or move on to a Demo

1200-1330: Lunch

1330-1400: Documentation
1400-1500: Modify Simplified App

1500-1530: Coffee

1530-1600: Check-in on documentation and modification process
1600-1630: Deployment
1630-1730: Discussion

Today we learn, tomorrow we build
Morning sessions 08:30–12:00 with a coffee break 10:00–10:30

title: 1. Overview of the workshop
section: We don’t have computer science training…
text:
We don’t have computer science training…
But we have figured it out with the help of these resources:


RStudio resources
GitHub
Stackoverflow
Google
Workshops and webinars (e.g., Data Carpentry, Openscapes, etc.)
Other people!

R user group at NEFSC, grad student group at Dal, Twitter (Tidy Tuesdays, R ladies, etc.)

title: 1. Overview of the workshop
section: Foundation of all data analysis is good data management
text:
Foundation of all data analysis is good data management


Consistent data types and column names

Date formatting
QA/QC of sources of human error

Write code to encompass universal processes

title: 1. Overview of the workshop
text:
Github and our workshop repo


Everyone should have a GitHub account by now
But what even is GitHub?

Tracks changes, eases collaboration with others and your future self, organizes your work

https://docs.github.com/en/get-started/quickstart/hello-world
http://ohi-science.org/data-science-training/github.html#setup-git-github


Tour of our workshop repository

text:

Do you have time-sensitive materials to distribute to stakeholders?

title: 9. Simplified App
text:
The code structure
App.R: dashboard

global_libraries.R
example_app.R: individual app run file

example_ui.R: user interface
example_server.R: nuts and bolts

example_report.Rmd: rmarkdown file rendered from the server file

title: 10. Documenting
text:
Using GitHub


version control (no more v1, final, final_FINAL, etc.)
Can revert back to earlier times
Back-up
Log issues
Wiki and Readme files

title: 10. Documenting
text:
Comments


for your future self and for others
explain what each line/process does

text:

Depending on the goals of your app, you may need to make a user guide so others can interact with it
Publish app in journals
